newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: NZ SHARES END FIRMER BUT OFF HIGHS IN CAUTIOUS MKT.
newsitem.headline: NZ SHARES END FIRMER BUT OFF HIGHS IN CAUTIOUS MKT.

text.p: * NZ shares end firmer but of intraday highs
* Volume moderate
* Market cautious ahead of U.S. CPI
Price movements at close
LAST CHG * NZSE-40 cap index +5.68 at 2,456.60
Brierley 136 +1 * NZSE-10 cap index +3.90 at 1,226.54
Carter Holt Harvey 334 -2 * NZSC cap index +9.83 at 5,240.48
Fletcher Paper 323 -3 * NZMC cap index +2.85 at 1,994.70
Lion Nathan 392 nil * Volume NZ$11 million. Futures +2 at 1,230
Telecom 742 +4 * Other movers - Tranz Rail +30 ANZ Banking +40
New Zealand share prices ended firmer on Thursday but off their intraday highs in a market which remains cautious ahead of key U.S. data.
The NZSE-40 Capital Index closed 5.68 points stronger at 2,456.60, with Telecom up four cents at NZ$7.42. The top-40 index peaked at 2,465.45 during the session.
"It got sold down this afternoon, but I just think looking at the close there's definitely a little bit more confidence around," said Luke Koekoek at brokers JB Were and Son.
He said U.S. consumer price data due out tonight NZ time would set the tone for both U.S. and New Zealand equities in the short-term, but noted a positive bias in the local market.

"It's obviously a big night tonight in the States, but looking at the market I would have thought that in most leading issues the support is definitely weighted to the buy side rather than the offer side.
"If all is okay tonight in the U.S., I think this market will continue to firm up a bit," he said.
Big movers on the day were Tranz Rail, up 30 at $8.60, and ANZ Bank, which gained 40 cents to $11.70.
Brokers said Tranz Rail ADRs had leapt higher overnight on speculation is was closing in on Australian railway assets, while ANZ was benefiting from a general rally in Australian banking stocks.
--Wellington Newsroom +64 4 4714 272
e-mail wellington.newsroom@reuters.com
